requirements.name: Biennial Statement (Form DOS-1513)
requirements.description: Statement filed with the New York Department of State every two years
requirements.due_date: Every 2 years in the calendar month of incorporation

requirements.name: Charitable Registration (CHAR410)
requirements.description: Initial registration with the New York Attorney General Charities Bureau

requirements.name: Annual Filing for Charitable Organizations (CHAR500)
requirements.description: Annual financial report filed with the Attorney General's Charities Bureau

requirements.name: Form 990 Series
requirements.description: IRS Form 990, 990-EZ, or 990-N required for tax-exempt organizations

requirements.name: Sales Tax Exemption Certificate (Form ST-119)
requirements.description: Exempt organization certificate for purchases exempt from sales tax
requirements.agency: New York State Department of Taxation and Finance

requirements.name: Unemployment Insurance Registration
requirements.description: Register with the New York State Department of Labor if organization has employees
requirements.agency: New York State Department of Labor

requirements.name: Professional Fundraiser Registration
requirements.description: Registration required if using professional fundraisers

requirements.name: Independent Audit (if applicable)
requirements.description: Organizations with gross revenue over $500,000 must have independent audit

notes: New York has some of the most stringent nonprofit oversight in the country. The Attorney General's Charities Bureau actively monitors compliance and can impose penalties for late filings. Organizations with revenue over $500,000 must submit audited financial statements.

key_agencies.name: New York Attorney General - Charities Bureau
New York State Department of Taxation and Finance
